name: Customize External Links and add Icon
author: blapps

sections.description:
This plugin adds and removes link relations such as nofollow and noreferrer to your external links. Furthermore, indication of external links by adding a custom icon to the link text. This plugin also adds automatically that external links will be opended in an new tab.

  • Add rel=nofollow for all the external links of your posts / pages / menus
  • Add target=_blank for all the external links of your posts / pages / menus
  • Exclude domains from addding rel=nofollow for the selected external links
  • Remove rel=noreferrer for all the external links of your posts / pages
  • Activate custom icon to indicate external links
  • Choose from different icons to mark links
  • Superscript Icon or regular size
  • Add custom CSS class to icon

The plugin is written by Janine, and is based on CyberNetikz Nofollow for external links plugin.
sections.installation:
From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’.
  2. Search for ‘Customize External Links’.
  3. Activate Customize External Links from your Plugins page.

From WordPress.org

  1. Download Customize External Links plugin.
  2. Upload the ‘customize-external-links’ directory to your ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory, using your favorite method (ftp, sftp, scp, etc…)
  3. Activate Customize External Links from your Plugins page.

Once Activated

  1. Visit WordPress dashboard sidebar in ‘Settings > Customize External Links’.
  2. Customize settings based on your needs.
sections.faq:
Can I exclude domain not to add ‘rel=nofollow’?

Yes, excluding certain domain names is possible. Please go to WordPress ‘Admin Panel > Settings > Customize External Links’ and enter domains.

Does this plugin work for custom post types?

Yes, custom post types are supported.

short_description: Customize link attributes, such as nofollow links, remove noreferrer, add icons to indicate external links
